findings.title: Admin can by mistake exceed totalsupply
findings.description: Admin can keep whitelisting allocations because there's no check/modifier to check whitelisted tokens are not exceeding hardcap.

findings.title: Admin can by mistake allocate more tokens
findings.description: Admin/backend service can allocate more tokens to any address(s), looking at current code it is not possible to deduct the allocated tokens if more tokens get allocated as compared to the intended amount.

findings.title: Reentrancy in buyTokensByUSDC function
findings.description: The finding is related to reentrancy vulnerability in the buyTokensByUSDC function.

findings.title: Broken Functionality in checkHardCaps modifier
findings.description: checkHardCaps modifier checks for hardcap <= totalMinted + _request which means hardcap should be less than or equal to totalminted tokens plus requested tokens. Here there can change <= check to >= in first condition in checkHardCaps modifier.

findings.title: Broken Functionality in withdrawUSDC function
findings.description: withdrawUSDC() is using ERC20 transferFrom instead of transfer , Which will revert with 'ERC20: insufficient allowance' error message as this contract don’t has allowance to itself to move to.

findings.title: Missing test cases
findings.description: Test cases for the code and functions have not been provided.

findings.title: Some functions can be declared external
findings.description: Declaring some functions as external can save gas each time they are executed.

findings.title: Redundant method
findings.description: The compiler automatically creates getter functions for all public state variables. No need to define new getter method.

findings.title: Check function name and error message
findings.description: Spelling mistakes in function name and error message may create confusion while calling contract functions through backend services and handling errors.
